Class HashTable

java.lang.Object
  HashTable

public class HashTable
extends java.lang.Object

HashTable implements a simple hash table scheme.

Version:
March 2015
Author:
Bill Keller

protected  int hashFunction(java.lang.String key)

Method Detail

compress

protected int compress(int code)
Method compress takes the hash code and transforms it to an integer

get

public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String key)
Get the value associated with a key.

Parameters:
key - a String
Returns:
the value associated with the key (or null if the hash table doesn't contain the key)

hashCode

protected int hashCode(java.lang.String key)
Method hashcode maps a String key to an integer code. The current implementation uses the polynomial accumulation method to generate a code. This method works well for String objects.

Parameters:
key - the String key
Returns:
the integer code

hashFunction

protected int hashFunction(java.lang.String key)
hashFunction maps a String to an integer within the range 0 to capacity-1, where capacity is the size of the underlying bucket array.

Parameters:
key - a String
Returns:
an integer hash

put

public java.lang.Object put(java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
Put a key value pair into the table.

Parameters:
key - a String
value - an Object associated with the key
Returns:
the value previously associated with key (or null if the hash table did not contain the key)
